data_table.description: ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, Exam 4. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: ETLD7
variable.description: Q-QS 1L. Q07 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead aVL
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead I or V6
Initial R amplitude decreasing to 2 mm or less in every beat (and absence of codes 3-2, 7-1-1, 7-2-1, or 7-3 between V5 and V6. (All beats in lead V5 must have an initial R > 2 mm.)
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead aVL

variable.name: ETLD8
variable.description: Q-QS 23. Q08 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration equal to 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.05 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave amplitude more or equal to 1.0 mm in the majority of beats in lead aVF
Q duration more or equal to 0.05 sec in lead aVF
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead II
QS pattern in lead II. Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec and < 0.05 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave more or equal to 1.0 mm amplitude in the majority of beats in aVF
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec and < 0.05 sec in lead aVF
Q amplitude more or equal to 5.0 mm in leads III or aVF
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave more or equal to 1.0 mm amplitude in the majority of beats in lead aVF
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead aVF
QS pattern in each of leads III and aVF. (Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1.)

variable.name: ETLD9
variable.description: Q-QS visit 1. Q09 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3 plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in any of leads V2-V5
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec in any of leads V1-V5
QS pattern when initial R-wave is present in adjacent lead to the right on the chest, in any of leads V2-V6
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec, in any of leads V2-V5
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in any of leads V2-V5
QS pattern in all of leads V1, V2, and V3. (Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1)

Initial R amplitude decreasing to 2.0 mm or less in every beat (and absence of codes 3-2, 7-1-1, 7-2-1, or 7-3) between any of leads V2 and V3, V3 and V4, or V4 and V5. (All beats in the lead immediately to the right on the chest must have an initial R >
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3 plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 and < 0.03 sec in any of leads V2-V5
QS pattern in lead V1 and V2. (Do not code in the presence of 3-1 or 7-1-1.)

variable.name: ETLD10
variable.description: S-T junction and segment 1L. Q10 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm, and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6

variable.name: ETLD11
variable.description: S-T junction and segment 23. Q11 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir = 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in lead II
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir = 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in lead II
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF

variable.name: ETLD12
variable.description: S-T junction and segment, visit 1. Q12 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1 - V5
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in any of leads V2 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm and ST segment upward sloping or U-shaped in any of leads V1 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1-V5
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1, V2, V3, V4, V5

variable.name: ETLD13
variable.description: T wave items 1L. Q13 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in either of leads I, V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm

T amplitude negative or diphasic (positive-negative or negative-positive type) with negative phase at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm

variable.name: ETLD14
variable.description: T wave items 23. Q14 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude negative or diphasic with negative phase (negative-positive or positive-negative type) at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead II; not coded in lead aVF

variable.name: ETLD15
variable.description: T wave items, visit 1. Q15 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in any of leads V2, V3, V4, V5
T amplitude negative or diphasic with negative phase (negative-positive or positive-negative type) at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead II; not coded in lead aVF

variable.name: ETLD16
variable.description: ST segments 1L. Q16 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]

variable.name: ETLD17
variable.description: ST segments 23. Q17 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF

variable.name: ETLD18
variable.description: ST segments, visit 1. Q18 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in lead V5 or ST segment elevation = 2.0 mm in any of leads V1-V4

variable.name: ETLD19
variable.description: R 3x. Q19 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: Left: R amplitude > 26 mm in either V5 or V6, or R amplitude > 20.0 mm in any of leads I, II, III, aVF, or R amplitude > 12.0 mm in lead aVL

Right: R amplitude more or equal to 5.0 mm and R amplitude more or equal to S amplitude in the majority of beats in lead V1, when S amplitude is > R amplitude somewhere to the left on the chest of V1 (codes 7-3 and 3-2, if criteria for both are present)

Left (optional code when 3-1 is not present): R amplitude > 15.0 mm but " 20.0 mm in lead I, or R amplitude in V5 or V6, plus S amplitude in V1 > 35.0 mm. (Measured only on second to last complete normal beat.)

variable.name: ETLD20
variable.description: A-V conduction defect 6x. Q20 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: P-R (P-Q) interval more or equal to 0.22 sec in the majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
Short P-R interval. P-R interval < 0.12 sec in all beats of any two of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
Artificial pacemaker
Wenckebach's Phenomenon (P-R interval increasing from beat to beat until QRS and T dropped)

Wolff-Parkinson-White Pattern (WPW), persistent. Sinus P-wave. P-R interval < 0.12 sec, plus QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec, plus R peak duration more or equal to 0.06 sec, coexisting in the same beat and present in the majority of beats in any of leads I, II, aVL, V4 - V6

variable.name: ETLD21
variable.description: Ventricular conduction defect 7x. Q21 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: Incomplete right bundle branch block. QRS duration < 0.12 sec in each of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, and R' > R in either of leads V1, V2 .(Code as 3-2 in addition if those criteria are met. 7-3 suppresses code 1-2-8.)
Intraventricular block. QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF. (7-4 suppresses all 2, 3, 4, 5, 9-2, 9-4, 9-5 codes.)
R-R' pattern in either of leads V1, V2 with R' amplitude more or equal to R

Incomplete left bundle branch block. (Do not code in the presence of any codable Q- or QS-wave.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.10 sec and < 0.12 in the majority of beats of each of leads I, aVL, and V5 or V6

Complete left bundle branch block (LBBB). (Do not code in presence of 6-1, 6-4-1, 6-8, 8-2-1 or 8-2-2.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, plus R peak duration more or equal to 0.06 sec in a majority of beats (of the sam

Complete right bundle branch block (RBBB). (Do not code in the presence of 6-1, 6-4-1, 6-8, 8-2-1 or 8-2-2.) QRS duration equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, plus: R' > R in V1 or V2; or QRS mainly upright, with R peak

variable.name: ETLD22
variable.description: Miscellaneous items 91. Q22 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: Low QRS amplitude. QRS peak-to-peak amplitude < 5 mm in all beats in each of leads I, II, III, or < 10 mm in all beats in each of leads V1-V6. (Check calibration before coding.)

variable.name: ETLD23
variable.description: Miscellaneous items 93. Q23 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: P-wave amplitude more or equal to 2.5 mm in any of leads II, III, aVF, in a majority of beats

variable.name: ETLD24
variable.description: Miscellaneous items 95. Q24 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: T-wave amplitude > 12 mm in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, V1, V2, V3, V4, V5, V6. (Do not code in the presence of 6-4-1, 7-1-1, 7-2-1 or 7-4.)

variable.name: ETLD25
variable.description: Miscellaneous items U. Q25 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]

variable.name: ETLD26
variable.description: Heart rate per minute. Q26 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]

variable.name: ETLD27
variable.description: Supp 8. Q27 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]

variable.name: ETLD28
variable.description: Tech problem. Q28 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]

variable.name: ETLD29
variable.description: Clear 10. Q29 [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]

variable.name: ETLDCY
variable.description: Contact year [10] [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]

variable.name: ETLDFLAG
variable.description: Indicator for presence of form [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
variable.value: Presence

variable.name: GWAS_ID
variable.description: ARIC participant ID [ECG Minnesota Visual Coded, exam 4]
